javadoc:
Command that runs in the background to move a memory block, as the move may
 be a time consuming operation.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a background command for moving memory blocks. The memory block
 is moved from its current start address to its new start address. After
 the command has completed, getStatus() can be called to check the
 success. If unsuccessful, getStatusMsg() can be called to get a message
 indicating why the command failed.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program whose memory map is being modified

params.name: currentStart
params.comment: the start address of the block before the move.

params.name: newStart
params.comment: the start address of the block after the move.

params.name: listener
params.comment:
listener that will be notified when the move block has
            completed.

methods.javadoc: Return true if the user cancelled the move command.
methods.name: isCancelled
methods.comment: Return true if the user cancelled the move command.

methods.javadoc:
Return whether the block was successfully moved.
@return true if the block was moved
methods.name: getStatus
methods.comment: Return whether the block was successfully moved.

return.comment: true if the block was moved

name: MoveBlockTask
comment:
Command that runs in the background to move a memory block, as the move may
 be a time consuming operation.
